channel.title: About Me on Houlton McGuinn
channel.description: Recent content in About Me on Houlton McGuinn

item.title: Backyard Hydrogen Line Astronomy
item.description: We can utilize a cheap (< $250) software-defined radio (SDR) backyard setup to observe the 21cm hydrogen line and probe the structure of our galaxy! One of the best parts of radio astronomy is that you can do it during the day! It can be a little more convenient to observe while the sun is up, and for our case specifically, the Milky Way is overhead for a decent chunk of the day.

item.title: About Me
item.description: it’s nice to meet you :) I’m Houlton McGuinn, a software engineer and security researcher. In 2022, I’ll be interning at Gusto in San Francisco. I’m studying computer science at UNC Chapel Hill. In my free time, I love indie movies, books, and art! I also enjoy reverse engineering IOT devices. If you’re reading this I’d love to chat! Feel free to reach out at houlton.mcguinn@gmail.com.
